thread.title: Australia go to lunch at 454 for 4 against Pakistan in 3rd Test, Day 2 after Matt Renshaw falls for 184
thread.title_full: Australia go to lunch at 454 for 4 against Pakistan in 3rd Test, Day 2 after Matt Renshaw falls for 184

author: Pramod Ananth | CricketCountry Staff
title: Australia go to lunch at 454 for 4 against Pakistan in 3rd Test, Day 2 after Matt Renshaw falls for 184
text:
› Series › Australia vs Pakistan 2016-17 › News Australia go to lunch at 454 for 4 against Pakistan in 3rd Test, Day 2 after Matt Renshaw falls for 184 Matt Renshaw, who struck his maiden ton on Tuesday, looked set to convert that into a double ton as he resumed Day Two in 167. | Updated  26 AM IST Matt Renshaw (Above) chopped one back on to his stumps off Imran Khan for 184 © Getty Images 
Matt Renshaw ’s innings was brought to an end at 184 as Australia go to lunch at 454 for 4 on Day Two of the third Test against Pakistan at Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG). Peter Handscomb remains unbeaten on 83, while debutant Hilton Cartwright is batting on 25. Handscomb now has a 50-plus score in each of his four Tests. Renshaw, who struck his maiden ton on Tuesday, looked set to convert that into a double ton as he resumed Day Two in 167. He added just 17 more runs to his tally as he dragged one back on to his stumps off Imran Khan, giving him his first wicket of the innings. 
After Renshaw’s dismissal in the sixth over of the day, Handscomb and Cartwright have batted very well and have also added for 50 for the fifth wicket. Cartwright in fact got off the mark with a boundary off the very first ball he faced in international cricket. They have taken their time, yet Australia continue to score at close to four an over. Handscomb especially has taken a liking to Yasir Shah. He has slog swept Yasir with utmost ease and has collected a boundary on almost all occasions. Pakistan have managed to cut down the run flow, but have not been able to create pressure to pick up more than a wicket. 
FULL CRICKET SCORECARD: Australia vs Pakistan 3rd Test at Sydney 
Australia had a chance to dismiss Cartwright right at the end of the session. Azhar Ali’s flighted ball took Cartwright’s outside edge. But Younis Khan failed to hang on to a low catch to his right, giving the youngster a lucky break. 
Australia resumed Day Two of the Test at 365 for 4, after winning the toss on Day One and electing to bat first. David Warner initially stole the limelight with a magnificent 78-ball ton, which he scored before lunch. Warner thus became the fifth batsman after Victor Trumper, Charles Maccartney, Don Bradman and Majid Khan to score a century before the first session on the first day of a Test. His opening partner Renshaw took some time to get going, but reached his first ever Test ton in just his fourth Test. 
Australia have already won the series and this match is nothing but a dead rubber. Australia won the first Test at Brisbane by 39 runs and followed that with an innings and 18-run win in the second Test at Melbourne. In this Test, other than Cartwright, Australia have also included Steve O’Keefe, who will partner Nathan Lyon in the spin department. As far as Pakistan are concerned, they have handed out a Test debut to Sharjeel Khan. Also, Imran Khan makes it back to the playing XI in place of Sohail Khan. 
Brief Scores : 
Australia 454 for 4 (Matt Renshaw 184, David Warner 113; Imran Khan 1 for 97, Wahab Riaz 2 for 70) vs Pakistan . Editorial team of CricketCountry.com  07  26 AM IST TOPICS:
